Posts.Content: Sep 2, 2007 10:47PM JennKeisner wrote: You will be ok. You can always have the mastectomy if you choose (I had it after my chemo was over because I had found out during my chemo that I tested positive for BRCA 1. Dont' be embarrassed to ask any questions to your doctors. If they make you feel like you are bothering them, find another doctor. You want someone who you feel comfortable with. My oncologist even gave me his email address and cell phone number if I need him. It is a long road but looking back, it went really fast. I found my lump 9/30/05 and I can't believe that it is almost 2 years ago. That time really flew. My hair is better then it was before and life is great! It will be fore you to. Just stay positive and never second guess yourself. Follow your gut. Good luck.
Posts.Title: Night time is the worst Kelolo konakat

Posts.Content: Oct 24, 2007 08:18PM JennKeisner wrote: The begininng is the worst but I can tell you this.  Today is my 2 year cancerversary and it went soooo fast.  Before you know it you will be on the other side of the fence saying "wow, I made it, look at me now"

Posts.Content: Dec 11, 2007 03:59AM JennKeisner wrote: I found my lump accidentally while sitting at the dinner table. It was the size of a golf ball. I had never had a mamogram because I was only 32 at the time.  I don't remember if it moved but I do not think so. It was very hard though.
Posts.Title: WHAT did YOUR lump FEEL like? gscott MomOfTeenGirl01
Help or support for spouses Dkissel sjoc

Posts.Content: Sep 2, 2007 04:51PM JennKeisner wrote: Mine was almost 3 months but that was kind of my choice. I was diagnosed 10/24/05. I had a lumpectomy on 10/27/05. 2 wks later I found that the sentinal node had minimal clusters of cancer so they had to go back in to remove them all on 11/27/05. I didn't want to be going through chemo during the holidays so I held off. I was supposed to start on 1/5/06, however, I wound up switching oncologists in the interum and my new one was on vacation that week. I had scheduled things (daughter's bday party etc) for my off weeks and needed to stay on that cycle so I didn't actually start chemo until 1/20/06. I am sure it will be fine. I don't think my onc would have allowed me to wait that long if they thought it would have been a problem.
